title: Jamestown man fatally shot self while hunting
content:
BUSTI – Thomas Carlson, the 50-year-old Jamestown man found dead in his hunting gear here early Monday afternoon, accidentally shot himself with his own weapon, according to Lakewood-Busti police officials.
Carlson was found by members of his own family in the area of Orr Street and Garfield Road in this Chautauqua County township. They called the Busti Fire Department for assistance. Around 12:45 p.m. the fire department and police confirmed the death.
Carlson's family went looking for him when he did not some home as expected, according to police officials.
Following a rash of recent hunting-related shooting incidents, state Department of Environmental Conservation officials stressed Monday the need for hunters to use common sense. Last year, for the first time in over 60 years, according to DEC officials, no hunting-related deaths were reported in the state.
So far this year there have been 23 hunting-related shootings. Ten, including Carlson's death, were self-inflicted accidental shootings. Thirteen others involved one hunter accidentally shooting another hunter, according to DEC officials.
